option3: rules of impeachment
option4: the State of the Union address

question: Which of the following is true of the Supreme Court?
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: The court helps set the public agenda by deciding which appeals to hear.
option1: Every case appealed to the Supreme Court is ruled upon by the court
option2: The court helps set the public agenda by deciding which appeals to hear
option3: The court hears all cases when two or more justices agree that the case has merit
option4: In deciding cases, the chief justice's vote counts as two votes

question: While best known for protecting freedom of speech and religion, the First Amendment also protects Americans' right to
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: petition the government for a redress of grievances
option1: due process of the law in any criminal case
option2: retain personal property unless justly compensated by the government
option3: not be subjected to excessive fines or unusual punishment
option4: petition the government for a redress of grievances

question: The Voting Rights Act of 1965 has had which of the following effects?
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: Voting participation for racial minority voters has increased.
option1: States have been prohibited from establishing voter identification requirements
option2: Voters must now pass literacy tests before voting
option3: Voting participation for racial minority voters has increased
option4: The voting age was lowered from 21 to 18

question: Considered as a single group, the Small Business Administration, the Small Business committees in the House and Senate, and small business advocacy groups are an example of
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: an iron triangle
option1: an iron triangle
option2: a conference committee
option3: a regulatory agency
option4: dual federalism

question: A writ of certiorari from the Supreme Court indicates that the Court
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: will review a lower court decision
option1: will review a lower court decision
option2: has rendered a decision on a case
option3: has decided not to hear an appeal
option4: will recess until the end of the calendar year

question: An example of a categorical grant would be
subject: high_school_government_and_politics

option2: money given by the federal government to states without conditions
option3: money loaned by the federal government to a private company to prevent it from failing
option4: money given by the federal government to states to fund Head Start early education programs

question: Congress has attempted to protect independent regulatory agencies from political influence by requiring that each agency
subject: high_school_government_and_politics

option2: plan policy cooperatively with the appropriate congressional committees

option4: submit all planned policy changes to the president for approval

question: Which of the following is true of congressional redistricting?
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: It occurs every 10 years to reflect changes in population according to the census.
option1: The responsibility for redrawing congressional districts belongs to congressional committees
option2: It is a noncontroversial process because it has few political ramifications
option3: It occurs every 10 years to reflect changes in population according to the census
option4: The Supreme Court has ruled that legislators may not consider racial demographics when redrawing districts

question: Which of the following most accurately describes The Federalist Papers?
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: A collection of essays arguing the merits of the Constitution

option2: A popular anti-British booklet of the pre-Revolutionary era
option3: A collection of essays arguing the merits of the Constitution
option4: A series of congressional acts defining the relationship between the federal and state governments

subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: They are tried in civil court.

option4: The state court system has exclusive jurisdiction over them

question: Which of the following statements about political action committees (PACs) is most accurate?
subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: They raise money to influence federal, state, and local elections
option1: They may only campaign for issues, not for individual candidates

option3: Their activities are limited to national presidential elections
option4: They raise money to influence federal, state, and local elections

subject: high_school_government_and_politics

option3: gave states the ability to override federal legislation
option4: empowered Congress to nullify executive actions

option2: McCulloch v. Maryland
option3: Gibbons v. Ogden
option4: Brown v. Board of Education

option4: better able to reflect the goals of their entire constituencies

subject: high_school_government_and_politics
groundtruth: Fourteenth Amendment
option1: First Amendment
option2: Sixth Amendment
option3: Ninth Amendment
option4: Fourteenth Amendment

option3: Congress can override a presidential veto if two-thirds of the House and Senate agree to do so
option4: Congressional power over the bureaucracy is less than that of the president

subject: high_school_government_and_politics

option2: By overturning the "separate but equal" principle, the Civil Rights Act of 1964 ended segregation in public schools

option4: The Civil Rights Act of 1964 sent federal troops to every segregated public school in the South to force school desegregation

option4: The House has a Committee on Ways and Means, while the Senate does not
